DOCNAME: CASE OF URUKALO AND NEMET v. CROATIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-1;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants ( husband and wife ) were born in DATE and DATE , respectively , and live in GPE , GPE .
CARDINAL . During a military operation undertaken during the Homeland War by ORG , in DATE , the applicants ' house in PERSON , GPE was destroyed .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants instituted civil proceedings in ORG ( PERSON u ORG ) against the ORG seeking damages for their destroyed property .

CARDINAL . On DATE the LAW to LAW ( “ the DATE LAW ) entered into force . The amended legislation provided that all proceedings instituted against the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War in GPE were to be stayed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicants ' claim . The applicants appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ( Županijski sud u ORG ) returned the case file to the first - instance court with an instruction to stay the proceedings pursuant to the above legislation .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG stayed the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE new legislation on the liability of the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War ( “ the DATE LAW ” ) entered into force .
CARDINAL . The Government submitted that the applicants ' proceedings had resumed pursuant to the above legislation and that they are currently pending before the second - instance court .
The applicants submitted that they had received no decision to resume the proceedings .

CARDINAL . Section CARDINAL ( a ) of the LAW to LAW ( Zakon o dopunama PERSON o obveznim odnosima , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) ( “ the DATE LAW provides that all proceedings instituted against the ORG for damage caused by members of ORG and police in the performance of their official duties during the Homeland War in GPE from CARDINAL DATE to DATE are to be stayed . The DATE Amendments also imposed an obligation on the Government to submit special legislation to ORG regulating liability for such damage within DATE of the Act entering into force .

CARDINAL . The Act on the liability of GPE for damage caused by members of the NORP army and police when acting in their official capacity during the homeland war ( Zakon o odgovornosti PERSON štetu uzrokovanu od pripadnika hrvatskih oružanih i redarstvenih snaga tijekom Domovinskog rata , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) ( “ the DATE LAW ” ) regulates the conditions under which the ORG is liable to pay compensation for damage caused by members of the army and the police during the Homeland War . It also provides that all proceedings stayed pursuant to the DATE Amendments are to be resumed .
CARDINAL . The relevant part of CARDINAL of LAW on LAW ( Ustavni zakon o PERSON , ORG no . CARDINAL of CARDINAL DATE ) ( “ the LAW ” ) reads as follows :

“ ( CARDINAL ) The Constitutional Court shall examine a constitutional complaint whether or not all legal remedies have been exhausted if the court with jurisdiction fails to decide a claim concerning the applicant 's rights and obligations or a criminal charge against him or her within a reasonable time ...

( CARDINAL ) If a constitutional complaint ... under paragraph CARDINAL of this section is upheld , the Constitutional Court shall set a time - limit within which the court with jurisdiction must decide the case on the merits ...

( CARDINAL ) In a decision issued under paragraph CARDINAL of this section , the Constitutional Court shall assess appropriate compensation for the applicant for the violation of his or her constitutional rights ... The compensation shall be paid out of the ORG budget within DATE from the date a request for payment is lodged . ”
CARDINAL . DATE ( Ustav Republike Hrvatske , ORG no . CARDINAL of DATE ) reads as follows :

“ In the determination of his rights and obligations or of any criminal charge against him , everyone is entitled to a fair hearing within a reasonable time by an independent and impartial court established by law . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG gave decision no . ORG in the case of PERSON N. , who had filed a constitutional complaint under section CARDINAL of the DATE LAW alleging a breach of LAW § CARDINAL of the LAW . He complained about the length of proceedings and the lack of access to a court because his action in the domestic courts had been stayed by statute for an extended period . In its decision , ORG held that there had been a violation of the constitutional rights to trial within a reasonable time and to access to a court . It ordered the court concerned to give a decision in Mr ORG 's case within DATE and awarded him compensation .
